definition: Thyroid hormone not attached to proteins.
example_usage: Free T4 is the best thyroid test.

definition: Tests that check how well blood clots.
example_usage: Coag panel ordered before surgery.

definition: Measures how long it takes blood to clot.
example_usage: PT is 12.5 seconds which is normal.

definition: A standard way to measure PT used for blood thinner medicine.
example_usage: INR goal is 2-3 for atrial fibrillation.

definition: Measures a different clotting pathway used for heparin medicine.
example_usage: PTT is longer on heparin therapy.

definition: A protein fragment that goes up when blood clots break down.
example_usage: High D-dimer suggests possible blood clot.

definition: Tests that check iron levels in the body.
example_usage: Iron studies ordered to check for low iron.

definition: Measures how much iron is in the blood.
example_usage: Low serum iron means iron deficiency.

definition: Measures blood's ability to carry iron.
example_usage: High TIBC in iron deficiency anemia.

definition: A protein that stores iron shows total body iron.
example_usage: Low ferritin confirms iron deficiency.

definition: A protein that carries iron in blood.
example_usage: Transferrin test helps diagnose iron problems.

definition: A marker of inflammation in the body.
example_usage: High CRP means active inflammation.

definition: A test for inflammation by how fast red blood cells settle.
example_usage: High ESR suggests inflammatory process.

definition: A heart enzyme released during heart muscle damage.
example_usage: High troponin confirms heart attack.

definition: A hormone released by the heart when it's failing.
example_usage: BNP of 450 means heart failure.

definition: A precursor to BNP that is a more stable heart failure marker.
example_usage: High NT-proBNP in heart failure.

definition: A protein made by prostate that goes up with cancer or enlargement.
example_usage: PSA screening in men over 50.

definition: A tumor marker that goes up in colon and other cancers.
example_usage: CEA watched in colon cancer patients.

definition: A tumor marker for pancreatic and stomach cancers.
example_usage: CA 19-9 high in pancreatic cancer.

definition: A tumor marker for ovarian cancer.
example_usage: CA-125 watched in ovarian cancer treatment.

definition: A tumor marker for liver cancer.
example_usage: High AFP suggests liver cancer.

definition: A test that checks urine for kidney disease or infection.
example_usage: UA shows bacteria and white blood cells.

definition: A test to find bacteria causing urinary tract infection.
example_usage: Urine culture grew E. coli.

definition: A test to find bacteria or fungi in the bloodstream.
example_usage: Blood cultures drawn before starting antibiotics.

definition: A test to find germs causing lung infection.
example_usage: Sputum culture positive for pneumonia bacteria.

definition: A calculated number showing how well kidneys work.
example_usage: eGFR of 55 means stage 3 kidney disease.

definition: Small amounts of protein in urine showing early kidney damage.
example_usage: Positive microalbumin in diabetic patient.

definition: Measures vitamin D levels in blood.
example_usage: Vitamin D level is 22 which is low.

definition: Measures B12 levels important for nerves and blood cells.
example_usage: Low B12 causes big red blood cells.

definition: Measures folic acid levels important for cell growth and blood.
example_usage: Low folate causes anemia.

definition: A mineral important for muscles and nerves.
example_usage: Magnesium level is 1.8 mEq/L.

definition: A mineral important for bones and energy.
example_usage: Phosphorus checked in kidney disease.

definition: A waste product that goes up in gout and kidney stones.
example_usage: High uric acid level triggers gout attack.

definition: A waste product broken down by liver.
example_usage: High ammonia causes confusion in liver failure.

definition: A byproduct made when body doesn't get enough oxygen.
example_usage: High lactate means sepsis or shock.

definition: An enzyme that digests carbohydrates.
example_usage: High amylase suggests pancreatitis.

definition: An enzyme that digests fats more specific for pancreas problems.
example_usage: High lipase in pancreas inflammation.

definition: An enzyme in muscles and heart that goes up with muscle damage.
example_usage: High CK after intense exercise.

definition: A heart-specific enzyme that goes up in heart attack.
example_usage: High CK-MB confirms heart muscle damage.

definition: An enzyme in many tissues that goes up in cell damage.
example_usage: High LDH in blood cell breakdown.

definition: A hormone made by adrenal glands for stress response.
example_usage: Low morning cortisol in adrenal problems.

definition: A brain hormone that tells adrenal glands to make cortisol.
example_usage: ACTH test checks adrenal function.

definition: A hormone important for male development and function.
example_usage: Low testosterone causes hypogonadism.

definition: A form of estrogen important for female reproduction.
example_usage: Estradiol watched in fertility treatment.

definition: A hormone important for periods and pregnancy.
example_usage: Progesterone level confirms ovulation.

definition: A hormone that controls reproduction.
example_usage: High FSH means menopause.

definition: A hormone that triggers ovulation and controls sex hormones.
example_usage: LH surge triggers ovulation.

definition: A hormone that makes breast milk.
example_usage: High prolactin causes milk production when not pregnant.

definition: A hormone made during pregnancy used in pregnancy tests.
example_usage: Positive hCG confirms pregnancy.

definition: Measures blood level of digoxin to ensure therapeutic dosing.
example_usage: Digoxin level is 1.2 ng/mL therapeutic range.

definition: Measures blood level of vancomycin antibiotic to guide dosing.
example_usage: Vancomycin trough is 18 mcg/mL.

definition: Measures blood level of anti-seizure medication phenytoin.
example_usage: Phenytoin level subtherapeutic at 6 mcg/mL.

definition: Measures blood level of theophylline bronchodilator medication.
example_usage: Theophylline level is 12 mcg/mL within range.

definition: A screening test for human immunodeficiency virus.
example_usage: Fourth generation HIV test is preferred.

definition: Tests for hepatitis A B and C viruses.
example_usage: Hepatitis panel ordered for jaundiced patient.

definition: A marker of active hepatitis B infection.
example_usage: Positive HBsAg indicates current HBV infection.

definition: Indicates immunity to hepatitis B from vaccine or past infection.
example_usage: Positive anti-HBs shows HBV immunity.

definition: Screening test for hepatitis C virus.
example_usage: Positive HCV antibody requires RNA confirmation.

definition: A screening test for syphilis.
example_usage: Positive RPR confirmed with FTA-ABS.

definition: A rapid test for Epstein-Barr virus causing infectious mononucleosis.
example_usage: Mono test positive with atypical lymphocytes.

definition: A rapid antigen test for Group A Streptococcus causing strep throat.
example_usage: Rapid strep test positive treat with antibiotics.

definition: A rapid test detecting influenza A and B viruses.
example_usage: Flu test positive for influenza A.

definition: A test detecting SARS-CoV-2 virus causing COVID-19.
example_usage: PCR COVID test is most accurate.

definition: An autoimmune marker elevated in lupus and other connective tissue diseases.
example_usage: Positive ANA with speckled pattern.

definition: An autoantibody elevated in rheumatoid arthritis.
example_usage: Positive RF supports RA diagnosis.

definition: A specific antibody for rheumatoid arthritis.
example_usage: Anti-CCP is more specific than RF for RA.

definition: A protein part of immune system low in active lupus.
example_usage: Low C3 indicates lupus flare.

definition: A protein part of immune system low in active lupus.
example_usage: Low C4 with low C3 in lupus nephritis.

definition: A screening test for hidden blood in stool indicating GI bleeding or cancer.
example_usage: Positive FOBT requires colonoscopy.

definition: A test identifying bacteria causing diarrhea.
example_usage: Stool culture positive for Salmonella.

definition: A test detecting toxin from C. diff bacteria causing severe diarrhea.
example_usage: C. diff toxin positive start vancomycin.

definition: A test for bacteria that causes stomach ulcers.
example_usage: Positive H. pylori treat with triple therapy.

definition: A urine or blood test detecting hCG to confirm pregnancy.
example_usage: Urine pregnancy test positive.

definition: A cervical cancer screening test examining cervical cells.
example_usage: Pap smear shows ASCUS repeat in 1 year.

definition: A test evaluating sperm count motility and morphology for fertility.
example_usage: Semen analysis shows oligospermia.

definition: High blood pressure that can damage the heart and blood vessels over time.
example_usage: Patient has HTN controlled with medication.

definition: A disease where blood sugar is too high because the body can't make or use insulin properly.
example_usage: Patient has DM type 2 managed with metformin.

definition: A type of diabetes where the body doesn't make insulin at all.
example_usage: Type 1 diabetes requires insulin injections.

definition: A type of diabetes where the body doesn't use insulin well.
example_usage: Type 2 diabetes managed with diet and pills.

definition: A lung disease that makes it hard to breathe usually from smoking.
example_usage: COPD patient uses inhalers daily.

definition: A condition where the heart can't pump blood well causing fluid buildup.
example_usage: CHF patient has swelling in legs.

definition: Long-term kidney damage that gets worse over time.
example_usage: CKD stage 3 requires monitoring.

definition: A heart attack where blood flow to heart muscle is blocked.
example_usage: Patient had MI last year needs cardiac rehab.

definition: A stroke where blood flow to the brain is blocked or a blood vessel bursts.
example_usage: CVA left patient with right-sided weakness.

definition: A mini-stroke with temporary symptoms that go away.
example_usage: TIA is a warning sign for future stroke.

definition: Narrowing of arteries that supply blood to the heart.
example_usage: CAD patient may need cardiac catheterization.

definition: Narrowing of arteries in the legs causing pain with walking.
example_usage: PAD causes leg pain when walking.

definition: An irregular heart rhythm that can cause blood clots.
example_usage: A-fib patient takes blood thinner.

definition: A blood clot in a deep vein usually in the leg.
example_usage: DVT requires anticoagulation therapy.

definition: A blood clot that travels to the lungs and blocks blood flow.
example_usage: PE is life-threatening requires immediate treatment.

definition: A lung condition causing airways to narrow and swell making breathing difficult.
example_usage: Asthma patient uses rescue inhaler.

definition: A mental health condition causing persistent sadness and loss of interest.
example_usage: Depression treated with therapy and medication.

definition: A mental health condition with excessive worry and fear.
example_usage: Anxiety managed with counseling and medication.

definition: A mental health condition triggered by experiencing or witnessing a traumatic event.
example_usage: PTSD patient has flashbacks and nightmares.

definition: A mental health condition with unwanted repetitive thoughts and behaviors.
example_usage: OCD patient has intrusive thoughts.

definition: A condition causing difficulty paying attention and controlling impulsive behaviors.
example_usage: ADHD managed with stimulant medication.

definition: A mental health condition with extreme mood swings from high to low.
example_usage: Bipolar patient has manic and depressive episodes.

definition: A mental health condition affecting how a person thinks feels and behaves.
example_usage: Schizophrenia treated with antipsychotic medication.

definition: A condition where stomach acid flows back into the throat causing heartburn.
example_usage: GERD treated with proton pump inhibitors.

definition: A disorder causing cramping bloating gas and diarrhea or constipation.
example_usage: IBS symptoms triggered by certain foods.

definition: Chronic inflammation of the digestive tract including Crohn's and ulcerative colitis.
example_usage: IBD requires ongoing treatment.

definition: A type of IBD causing inflammation anywhere in the digestive tract.
example_usage: Crohn disease patient has frequent diarrhea.

definition: A type of IBD causing inflammation and ulcers in the colon and rectum.
example_usage: Ulcerative colitis patient has bloody diarrhea.

definition: An autoimmune disorder where eating gluten damages the small intestine.
example_usage: Celiac disease requires gluten-free diet.

definition: Inflammation of small pouches in the colon wall.
example_usage: Diverticulitis causes left lower abdominal pain.

definition: Severe scarring of the liver from long-term damage.
example_usage: Cirrhosis from chronic alcohol use.

definition: Inflammation of the liver usually from a virus.
example_usage: Hepatitis B can become chronic.

definition: Inflammation of the pancreas causing severe abdominal pain.
example_usage: Acute pancreatitis requires hospitalization.

definition: Inflammation of the gallbladder usually from gallstones.
example_usage: Cholecystitis treated with gallbladder removal.

definition: Inflammation of the appendix requiring emergency surgery.
example_usage: Appendicitis causes right lower abdominal pain.

definition: A condition where the thyroid gland doesn't make enough thyroid hormone.
example_usage: Hypothyroidism causes fatigue and weight gain.

definition: A condition where the thyroid gland makes too much thyroid hormone.
example_usage: Hyperthyroidism causes weight loss and rapid heartbeat.

definition: An autoimmune disorder causing hyperthyroidism.
example_usage: Graves disease can cause bulging eyes.

definition: An autoimmune disorder causing hypothyroidism.
example_usage: Hashimoto disease most common cause of hypothyroidism.

definition: A rare disorder where adrenal glands don't make enough hormones.
example_usage: Addison disease causes weakness and low blood pressure.

definition: A condition caused by too much cortisol hormone.
example_usage: Cushing syndrome causes weight gain and round face.

definition: Having too much body fat increasing health risks.
example_usage: Obesity increases risk of diabetes and heart disease.

definition: A cluster of conditions increasing risk of heart disease and diabetes.
example_usage: Metabolic syndrome includes high BP sugar and cholesterol.

definition: High levels of fats in the blood including cholesterol.
example_usage: Hyperlipidemia treated with statins.

definition: A type of arthritis causing sudden severe joint pain from uric acid crystals.
example_usage: Gout attack affects big toe.

definition: An autoimmune disease causing painful swelling in the joints.
example_usage: RA affects hands and feet symmetrically.

definition: Wear and tear arthritis from cartilage breakdown.
example_usage: OA most common in knees and hips.

definition: An autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs.
example_usage: Lupus causes butterfly rash on face.

definition: A disorder causing widespread muscle pain and fatigue.
example_usage: Fibromyalgia patient has multiple tender points.

definition: A condition where bones become weak and brittle.
example_usage: Osteoporosis increases fracture risk.

definition: A condition with too few red blood cells or low hemoglobin.
example_usage: Anemia causes fatigue and weakness.

definition: An inherited blood disorder with abnormal red blood cells.
example_usage: Sickle cell disease causes pain crises.

definition: An inherited bleeding disorder where blood doesn't clot properly.
example_usage: Hemophilia patient needs clotting factor.

definition: Cancer of blood-forming tissues including bone marrow.
example_usage: Leukemia causes too many abnormal white blood cells.

definition: Cancer of the lymphatic system.
example_usage: Lymphoma causes swollen lymph nodes.

definition: Cancer of plasma cells in bone marrow.
example_usage: Multiple myeloma causes bone pain and fractures.

definition: Cancer that forms in breast tissue.
example_usage: Breast cancer detected on mammogram.

definition: Cancer that starts in the lungs usually from smoking.
example_usage: Lung cancer diagnosed with CT scan and biopsy.

definition: Cancer of the colon or rectum.
example_usage: Colon cancer screening starts at age 45.

definition: Cancer of the prostate gland in men.
example_usage: Prostate cancer detected by elevated PSA.

definition: Cancer that develops in skin cells.
example_usage: Skin cancer includes melanoma and basal cell.

definition: The most serious type of skin cancer.
example_usage: Melanoma can spread to other organs.

definition: A brain disorder causing memory loss and confusion.
example_usage: Alzheimer disease is most common dementia.

definition: A decline in memory and thinking skills affecting daily life.
example_usage: Dementia includes Alzheimer and vascular types.

definition: A brain disorder causing tremor and movement problems.
example_usage: Parkinson disease causes shuffling walk.

definition: An autoimmune disease damaging nerve coverings in brain and spine.
example_usage: MS causes vision problems and weakness.

definition: A brain disorder causing repeated seizures.
example_usage: Epilepsy controlled with anti-seizure medication.

definition: A type of headache causing severe throbbing pain.
example_usage: Migraine patient has nausea and light sensitivity.

definition: Nerve damage causing numbness tingling and pain usually in hands and feet.
example_usage: Diabetic neuropathy is most common type.

definition: Sudden weakness or paralysis of facial muscles on one side.
example_usage: Bell palsy causes drooping on one side of face.

definition: Numbness and tingling in hand from compressed nerve in wrist.
example_usage: Carpal tunnel syndrome from repetitive hand use.

definition: A disorder where breathing stops and starts during sleep.
example_usage: Sleep apnea treated with CPAP machine.

definition: Infection causing inflammation in the lungs.
example_usage: Pneumonia causes cough fever and shortness of breath.

definition: Inflammation of the airways in the lungs.
example_usage: Acute bronchitis causes cough with mucus.

definition: A serious bacterial infection affecting the lungs.
example_usage: TB requires months of antibiotics.

definition: An infectious disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 virus.
example_usage: COVID-19 patient has fever and cough.

definition: A contagious respiratory illness caused by flu viruses.
example_usage: Influenza causes fever body aches and fatigue.

definition: Infection of nose throat and airways.
example_usage: URI includes common cold.

definition: Inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain and congestion.
example_usage: Acute sinusitis treated with antibiotics.

definition: Inflammation of the throat causing sore throat.
example_usage: Strep pharyngitis requires antibiotics.

definition: Middle ear infection common in children.
example_usage: Otitis media causes ear pain and fever.

definition: Infection in any part of the urinary system.
example_usage: UTI causes burning with urination.

definition: Kidney infection usually from untreated UTI.
example_usage: Pyelonephritis causes back pain and high fever.

definition: Bladder inflammation usually from infection.
example_usage: Cystitis causes frequent painful urination.

definition: A bacterial skin infection causing redness and swelling.
example_usage: Cellulitis requires antibiotics.

definition: A collection of pus from bacterial infection.
example_usage: Abscess requires drainage and antibiotics.

definition: A life-threatening response to infection affecting the whole body.
example_usage: Sepsis requires ICU care and IV antibiotics.

definition: Inflammation of membranes covering brain and spinal cord.
example_usage: Bacterial meningitis is a medical emergency.

definition: Inflammation of the brain usually from viral infection.
example_usage: Encephalitis causes confusion and seizures.

definition: A virus that attacks the immune system.
example_usage: HIV managed with antiretroviral therapy.

definition: The most advanced stage of HIV infection.
example_usage: AIDS diagnosis when CD4 count very low.

definition: A viral infection causing liver inflammation.
example_usage: Hepatitis B vaccine prevents infection.

definition: A viral infection causing chronic liver disease.
example_usage: Hepatitis C now curable with antiviral drugs.

definition: A viral infection causing cold sores or genital lesions.
example_usage: HSV-1 causes cold sores on mouth.

definition: A painful rash from reactivation of chickenpox virus.
example_usage: Shingles vaccine recommended after age 50.

definition: A contagious infection causing itchy rash and blisters.
example_usage: Chickenpox vaccine given to children.

definition: A highly contagious viral infection with rash and fever.
example_usage: Measles preventable with MMR vaccine.

definition: A viral infection causing swelling of salivary glands.
example_usage: Mumps preventable with MMR vaccine.

definition: A viral infection with mild rash dangerous in pregnancy.
example_usage: Rubella preventable with MMR vaccine.

definition: A viral infection causing extreme fatigue and sore throat.
example_usage: Mono caused by Epstein-Barr virus.

definition: A bacterial infection from tick bites.
example_usage: Lyme disease causes bull's-eye rash.

definition: A type of staph bacteria resistant to many antibiotics.
example_usage: MRSA skin infection requires special antibiotics.

definition: A bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea.
example_usage: C. diff from antibiotic use.

definition: A skin infestation by mites causing intense itching.
example_usage: Scabies spreads through close contact.

definition: A skin condition with pimples from clogged pores.
example_usage: Acne treated with topical and oral medications.

definition: A condition causing itchy inflamed skin.
example_usage: Eczema managed with moisturizers and steroids.

definition: An autoimmune condition causing thick scaly skin patches.
example_usage: Psoriasis treated with topical and systemic drugs.

definition: A skin condition causing facial redness and bumps.
example_usage: Rosacea triggered by sun and spicy foods.

definition: Enlarged prostate gland causing urinary problems.
example_usage: BPH common in older men.

definition: Inability to achieve or maintain an erection.
example_usage: ED treated with medications like sildenafil.

definition: A condition where uterine tissue grows outside the uterus causing pain.
example_usage: Endometriosis causes severe menstrual cramps.

definition: A hormonal disorder causing irregular periods and cysts on ovaries.
example_usage: PCOS causes irregular periods and excess hair.

definition: Noncancerous growths in the uterus.
example_usage: Fibroids can cause heavy menstrual bleeding.

definition: Infection of female reproductive organs.
example_usage: PID from untreated STI can cause infertility.

definition: An infection passed through sexual contact.
example_usage: STI screening important for sexually active people.

definition: A common bacterial STI often without symptoms.
example_usage: Chlamydia treated with antibiotics.

definition: A bacterial STI causing discharge and pain.
example_usage: Gonorrhea treated with antibiotics.

definition: A bacterial STI that progresses through stages.
example_usage: Syphilis treated with penicillin.

definition: A viral infection causing warts and linked to cancer.
example_usage: HPV vaccine prevents most cancer-causing types.

definition: A viral STI causing painful genital sores.
example_usage: Genital herpes caused by HSV-2.

definition: A parasitic STI causing discharge and irritation.
example_usage: Trichomoniasis treated with metronidazole.

definition: An imbalance of vaginal bacteria causing discharge.
example_usage: BV treated with metronidazole.

definition: A fungal infection causing itching and discharge.
example_usage: Yeast infection treated with antifungal cream.

definition: High blood pressure during pregnancy that can be dangerous.
example_usage: Preeclampsia requires close monitoring.
